children.text: CCSS.Math.Content.HSA.APR.B.2 Know and apply the Remainder Theorem: For a polynomial p ( x ) and a number a , the remainder on division by x - a is p ( a ), so p ( a ) = 0 if and only if ( x - a ) is a factor of p ( x ).
CCSS.Math.Content.HSA.APR.B.3 Identify zeros of polynomials when suitable factorizations are available, and use the zeros to construct a rough graph of the function defined by the polynomial.
